{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3322226,"name":"John Hascall (he)","username":"john3928","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/john3928/{size}/143275_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-02T21:47:23.568Z","cooked":"

Last weekend when inspecting robots at a Week 0 scrimmage I came across a situation I haven‚Äôt seen before.

When doing the R611 check for the frame being isolated from the electrical system, I had a robot read about 1MŒ©. Always before I have gotten ‚Äúopen‚Äù (‚àûŒ©). I assured the team that they passed as any value above 120Œ© is ok, but they were understandably curious about what could be causing that reading, but I had no real ideas for them.

Any ideas what could cause a reading like that?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2024-03-02T21:47:23.568Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":15,"reads":421,"readers_count":420,"score":189.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":456984,"topic_slug":"r611-frame-isolated-from-electrical-system","display_username":"John Hascall (he)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":46267,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Opinions expressed are mine only"},"post_url":"/t/r611-frame-isolated-from-electrical-system/456984/1","custom_user_title":"Opinions expressed are mine only","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3322228,"name":"Jon Stratis","username":"Jon_Stratis","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jon_stratis/{size}/2663_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-02T22:01:49.921Z","cooked":"

I‚Äôve seen levels around there before, it‚Äôs typically coming through a motor - I believe CIM motors did that quite often, especially after being used for a bit. I‚Äôve seen a lot more 3k-6k this year than ever before, and I‚Äôm baffled on where those are coming from.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2024-03-02T22:01:49.921Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":411,"readers_count":410,"score":102.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":456984,"topic_slug":"r611-frame-isolated-from-electrical-system","display_username":"Jon Stratis","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7968,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 2177 Mentor, LRI, MN RPC"},"post_url":"/t/r611-frame-isolated-from-electrical-system/456984/2","custom_user_title":"FRC 2177 Mentor, LRI, MN RPC","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3322237,"name":"garyk","username":"garyk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/garyk/{size}/113200_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-02T22:23:20.790Z","cooked":"

Yeah, I‚Äôve seen values in K‚Äôs of ohms. Haven‚Äôt investigated, would be interesting.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2024-03-02T22:23:20.790Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":390,"readers_count":389,"score":93.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":456984,"topic_slug":"r611-frame-isolated-from-electrical-system","display_username":"garyk","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":7968,"username":"Jon_Stratis","name":"Jon Stratis","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jon_stratis/{size}/2663_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7232,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/r611-frame-isolated-from-electrical-system/456984/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3322243,"name":"Drew Williams","username":"jreneew2","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jreneew2/{size}/135239_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-02T22:36:16.227Z","cooked":"

We had a similar issue in 2018 where our swerve azimuth encoders had a metal case and were touching our frame. We just added a small layer of tape before mounting them and it fixed our issue

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2024-03-02T22:36:16.227Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":370,"readers_count":369,"score":89.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":456984,"topic_slug":"r611-frame-isolated-from-electrical-system","display_username":"Drew Williams","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":21777,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":" I moved to California just for districts"},"post_url":"/t/r611-frame-isolated-from-electrical-system/456984/4","custom_user_title":" I moved to California just for districts","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3322506,"name":"paulonis","username":"paulonis","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/5fc32e/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-03T12:11:38.448Z","cooked":"

Conductive plastic casing on sensors or other devices can also be the cause. Sharp distance sensors are known to have this problem. Mounting a conductive case on tape, on plastic, or Velcro/DualLock is an easy fix. Of course, you have to find the offending component first, which may not be easy.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2024-03-03T12:11:38.448Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":321,"readers_count":320,"score":64.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":456984,"topic_slug":"r611-frame-isolated-from-electrical-system","display_username":"paulonis","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":22261,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/r611-frame-isolated-from-electrical-system/456984/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3322519,"name":"Chris Gerth","username":"gerthworm","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gerthworm/{size}/268658_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-03T13:01:41.313Z","cooked":"

We‚Äôve seen similar, neo550‚Äôs as well seem to have exhibit the slightly-conductive syndrome

It also depends on the method the multimeter uses. An ac signal could theoretically induce a bit of current in the motor winding, which induces a bit of current in the motor housing, which electrically connects to the frame, and reads back at the meter as a tiny bit of current leak.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2024-03-03T13:03:46.006Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":295,"readers_count":294,"score":74.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":456984,"topic_slug":"r611-frame-isolated-from-electrical-system","display_username":"Chris Gerth","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24617,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/r611-frame-isolated-from-electrical-system/456984/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3322570,"name":"John Hascall (he)","username":"john3928","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/john3928/{size}/143275_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-03T15:48:09.654Z","cooked":"

Thanks everyone, now I have plausible suggestions.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2024-03-03T15:48:09.654Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":248,"readers_count":247,"score":49.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":456984,"topic_slug":"r611-frame-isolated-from-electrical-system","display_username":"John Hascall (he)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":46267,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Opinions expressed are mine only"},"post_url":"/t/r611-frame-isolated-from-electrical-system/456984/7","custom_user_title":"Opinions expressed are mine only","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3322657,"name":"Rod","username":"Weldingrod1","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/weldingrod1/{size}/162109_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-03T18:36:04.274Z","cooked":"

Don‚Äôt forget the conductivity of the operator
You are a moderately high value resistor‚Ä¶

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2024-03-03T18:36:04.274Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":228,"readers_count":227,"score":50.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":456984,"topic_slug":"r611-frame-isolated-from-electrical-system","display_username":"Rod","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":46443,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/r611-frame-isolated-from-electrical-system/456984/8","custom_user_title":"Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3322667,"name":"FrankJ","username":"FrankJ","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/frankj/{size}/5392_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-03T19:02:07.325Z","cooked":"

Basic rule of electrical work is don‚Äôt touch the leads.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2024-03-03T19:02:07.325Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":202,"readers_count":201,"score":45.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":456984,"topic_slug":"r611-frame-isolated-from-electrical-system","display_username":"FrankJ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":46443,"username":"Weldingrod1","name":"Rod","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/weldingrod1/{size}/162109_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":15944,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2974 Robot Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/r611-frame-isolated-from-electrical-system/456984/9","custom_user_title":"2974 Robot Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3322810,"name":"garyk","username":"garyk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/garyk/{size}/113200_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-03T22:50:17.645Z","cooked":"

The mounting stud of some cameras is grounded. We‚Äôve had to create a nonconducting bracket/plate as an intermediary layer between camera and ‚Äòbot frame.

Interestingly enough, the box in R611 explains all this!

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2024-03-03T22:50:17.645Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":175,"readers_count":174,"score":45.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":456984,"topic_slug":"r611-frame-isolated-from-electrical-system","display_username":"garyk","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":15944,"username":"FrankJ","name":"FrankJ","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/frankj/{size}/5392_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7232,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/r611-frame-isolated-from-electrical-system/456984/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3322839,"name":"John Hascall (he)","username":"john3928","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/john3928/{size}/143275_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-03T23:44:05.657Z","cooked":"
garyk:

Interestingly enough, the box in R611 explains all this!

Ah, the box says those are things which will fail the test ‚Äî which I (mistakenly) took as things which would give a reading of less than 120 ohms.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2024-03-03T23:44:05.657Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":160,"readers_count":159,"score":32.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":456984,"topic_slug":"r611-frame-isolated-from-electrical-system","display_username":"John Hascall (he)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":46267,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Opinions expressed are mine only"},"post_url":"/t/r611-frame-isolated-from-electrical-system/456984/11","custom_user_title":"Opinions expressed are mine only","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3326079,"name":"k.gill","username":"karin.gill123","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/f07891/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-06T20:24:49.735Z","cooked":"

Does anyone have a good set of instructions for testing electrical isolation? Including what to set the multimeter to. Thanks in advance!
Team 5863

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2024-03-06T20:24:49.735Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":117,"readers_count":116,"score":33.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":456984,"topic_slug":"r611-frame-isolated-from-electrical-system","display_username":"k.gill","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":27413,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/r611-frame-isolated-from-electrical-system/456984/12","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3326087,"name":"John Hascall (he)","username":"john3928","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/john3928/{size}/143275_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-06T20:31:14.946Z","cooked":"

Set your multimeter to measure resistance. Typically it will be called out as ‚ÄúŒ©‚Äù or maybe Ohms.

then, with battery OUT and main breaker ON, one meter probe goes in the red side of the battery connector (touching the metal contact) on the robot and then you touch the other probe to various metal spots on the robot frame/structure. Repeat with the black side of the battery connector.

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2024-03-06T20:31:14.946Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":12,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":111,"readers_count":110,"score":62.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":456984,"topic_slug":"r611-frame-isolated-from-electrical-system","display_username":"John Hascall (he)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":27413,"username":"karin.gill123","name":"k.gill","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/f07891/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":46267,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Opinions expressed are mine only"},"post_url":"/t/r611-frame-isolated-from-electrical-system/456984/13","custom_user_title":"Opinions expressed are mine only","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3326106,"name":"Rod","username":"Weldingrod1","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/weldingrod1/{size}/162109_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-06T20:43:25.009Z","cooked":"

You mean we aren‚Äôt allowed to use a proper megger?

I know, I know‚Ä¶ Just joking! I won‚Äôt bring my megger‚Ä¶

We had a bit of a scare during inspection for this same reason, the multimeter was automatically setting it‚Äôs units to mega-ohms. They had to break out the rule book to check what the acceptable resistance was.

The only way we could actually get it to read zero was to unplug the power from all of our MaxSwerve drives, so I assume it was coming from the Neos or 550s
